cell.color: Black Sea and the surrounding rivers.

Class: Ray finned fishes (Actinopterygii)
Order: Sturgeon and Paddlefishes( Acipenseriformes)
Family: Sturgeon (Acipenseridae)
Genus: Acipenser
Species: A. gueldenstaedtii

color.font: Fun facts about the Russian sturgeon.

cell.color: Due to overfishing, water pollution and the closure of breeding places, the Russian sturgeon has a hard time surviving.
When its breeding time, they go to the rivers to lay a proximally 800,000 eggs per fish.
The Russion sturgeon used to eat small herring like fish, but nowadays they eat snails, mussels and worms, who are introducted in the area by the humans.

text.cell:
In Challenge and Campaign mode the Russian sturgeon will be available when your zoo has reached 0.5 stars.
Habitat: The Russian sturgeon lives in the Black and Caspian seas and their rivers.
Natural food: The Russion sturgeon used to eat small herring like fish, but nowadays they eat snails, mussels and worms, which are introducted in the area by the humans. With their projecting wedgeshaped snout they stir up the soft bottom, and with their sensitive barbels they detect the fish and other foods.
Poaching: Just like other sturgeons, the Russian sturgeon is in endagered species. Due to overfishing, water pollution and the closure of breeding places, the Russian sturgeon has a hard time surviving. Because poaching in the Caspian sea is prohibited and the planting of artificially breeded young animals has called a first halt to the decrease of Russian sturgeon population.
Reproduction in the wild: When its breeding time, they go to the rivers to lay a proximally 800,000 eggs per fish. The young stay their first year in the river where they were born, after that they go to the sea to grow up.
Threat: Due to overfishing, water pollution and the closure of breeding places, the Russian sturgeon has a hard time surviving.
Information from: http://www.zodiacanimals.nl Made by Dennis1991!
